course_title: Topics in Mathematics: Math. Foundations Data Science
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 4Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Required prerequisite: MATH 221 and MATH 211 or MATH 210. Please contact Ms. Taylr Tuggle (taylr.annece.tuggle@emory.edu) for permission. 
The goal of this class is to provide the necessary mathematical foundations for modern data science.  Topics include numerical linear algebra, image compression, clustering, regression, numerical methods for least-squares problems, large-scale numerical optimization, nonlinear regression, and unsupervised and supervised learning techniques.  The course introduces students to theory and methods for data science, and students get hands-on experience working on examples from a variety of applications.
course_description: Rotating topics in mathematics. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies. Pre and co requisites depend on the topic offered.
schedule_location: TTh 11:30am-12:45pm in Math & Science Center - W303
